messages.subject: Re: Computer tip
messages.msgSnippet: I can t think of a way to make this any kind of a Buddhist precept, but do you know that by clicking once and *holding down* you have access to everything that
messages.messageBody:
I can't think of a way to make this any kind of a Buddhist precept, but do
you know that by clicking once and *holding down* you have access to
everything that those two button mice have?

jocelyn vilter
also on a Macintosh


Message: 4
Date: Thu, 30 May 2002 09:21:17 EDT
From: SandraDodd@...
Subject: Re: Computer tip - was biggest spiders


In a message dated 5/30/02 6:35:16 AM, dcannon@... writes:

<< Right clicking is your friend >>

As a Macintosh user without more than one "click" available, I see the
statement above as a Buddhist precept. "Right clicking" as Right Action for
computer moments.

Sandra
